name: Tofu With Peanut-Ginger Sauce
description:
If you don’t feel like cooking on a hot summer day, you can enjoy plain cold tofu with a dipping sauce. Or you can sear it quickly in a pan or grill it. This recipe and the others that follow it this week make enough sauce or marinade for a pound of tofu.

Spread this sweet and pungent peanut sauce on seared, grilled or uncooked tofu. It also makes a nice dipping sauce for crudités or spring rolls.
keywords: appetizer, dairy-free, gluten-free, healthy, low cholesterol, vegan, vegetarian, ginger, peanut butter, tofu, summer
recipeIngredient: 3 tablespoons creamy unsalted, unsweetened peanut butter
1 to 2 teaspoons light brown sugar, to taste
1 1/2 teaspoon ginger juice (grate 1 tablespoon ginger, wrap in cheesecloth and squeeze)

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, whisk together all the above ingredients. Thin out as desired with water. Brush or spoon onto sliced tofu (cooked or uncooked).
